main event: Several citizens of Gonzales, Texas, observed an unusual aerial phenomena on 20-21 May 1952, with the object appearing to hover, vanish into a ball of fire, and travel from east to west.
interesting points: The sightings lasted approximately 10 to 15 minutes each.
Witnesses observed around 6 to 8 appearances of the aerial phenomena.
The object was described as aluminum in color and 'saucer-like' in shape.
It appeared to vanish in a ball of fire, and there were no markings or insignia on the object.
The credibility of the witnesses varied, with some being considered completely reliable and trustworthy, while others were said to be boastful and inclined to be credulous.
